page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY-Skelton Castle
page.content: Robert De Brus(second) built a castle at Skelton about 1140. It was made of stone and had 2 look-out towers, dungeons, and a moat with a drawbridge and portcullis. Over the years the castle became neglected. It started to crumble and rats and frogs lived in the dungeons and cellars. People called it "Crazy Castle". John Hall Stevenson inherited this in 1786. His great grandmother was very rich. Before she married, her name was Wharton, and she said she would give him all of her money if he changed his name to Wharton, so he did. He built a new castle in 1788 with front-extensions in 1810. Mrs. Margaret Winsome Ringrose Wharton owns the castle now but her relative, Major Wharton, runs the estates as she is too old to do it herself.
